intro: Cynometra sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elongated, elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Its wood is highly valued for its durability and fine grain, making it important in local timber industries. The plant also has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
